definitions: of or relating to the natural force that attracts objects toward each other
examples: The gravitational pull of the moon affects ocean tides
Earth's gravitational field keeps satellites in orbit

definitions: of a color between black and white like ash or lead
lacking brightness or interest; overcast with clouds and dull
not clearly defined as right or wrong; ethically ambiguous or uncertain
examples: The gray suit matched his silver tie perfectly
Her gray hair shone like polished silver
The gray morning promised rain all day long
Life in the factory town seemed endlessly gray
The ethical decision fell into a gray area of company policy
There are many gray zones in international law

definitions: having a slight gray color or tinge mixed with another color
examples: The grayish blue walls created a calming atmosphere
Her complexion had a grayish pallor from illness

definitions: having fed on grass or vegetation in a field or pasture
having the surface slightly scraped or worn away by rubbing
examples: The grazed fields showed signs of the cattle's presence
These grazed pastures support hundreds of sheep
Her grazed knee stung from the playground fall
The grazed metal surface revealed rust underneath

definitions: covered or lubricated with oil, fat, or another thick lubricating substance
examples: The greased pan prevented the cake from sticking
Well greased gears run smoothly without friction

definitions: covered with or containing an excessive amount of grease or oil
producing or appearing to secrete too much oil, especially on skin or hair
examples: The greasy dishes needed extra soap to clean properly
His greasy fingerprints were all over the glass
Her greasy hair needed washing after three days
The teenager struggled with greasy skin problems

definitions: of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above average or normal
of ability, quality, or eminence considerably above average; excellent
having achieved lasting importance or recognition in a particular sphere
examples: A great crowd gathered to hear the announcement
The storm caused great damage to coastal areas
She wrote a great novel that won several awards
The restaurant serves great Italian food every night
Mozart was one of the great composers of classical music
The great leaders of history shaped our modern world

definitions: of a larger size, amount, extent, or degree in comparison
examples: The greater distance made communication more difficult
We need greater effort to achieve our goals

definitions: of the highest degree, amount, or intensity; surpassing all others
examples: This was her greatest achievement in twenty years
The greatest challenge facing humanity is climate change

definitions: having or showing an intense and selfish desire for wealth or possessions
examples: The greedy investor lost everything trying to maximize profits
Don't be greedy and take more than your fair share

definitions: of the color between blue and yellow in the spectrum like grass
concerned with or supporting protection of the environment from pollution
lacking experience, knowledge, or sophistication; naive or gullible
not yet ripe or ready for harvesting or eating
examples: The green leaves rustled gently in the breeze
She wore a beautiful green dress to the party
The company adopted green policies to reduce carbon emissions
Many consumers prefer green products over conventional ones
The green recruits needed extensive training before deployment
Don't be so green about business negotiations
These green tomatoes will ripen in a few days
The green bananas were too hard to eat

definitions: relating to or denoting a glass building for growing plants
examples: Greenhouse gases trap heat in Earth's atmosphere
The greenhouse effect causes global temperature increases

definitions: having a slight green color or tinge mixed with another color
examples: The greenish water indicated algae growth in the pool
Her greenish complexion suggested she might be ill

definitions: fond of company; sociable and enjoying the company of other people
examples: His gregarious personality made him popular at parties
Gregarious animals live together in herds or flocks

definitions: of a color between black and white like ash or lead
lacking brightness or interest; overcast with clouds and dull
not clearly defined as right or wrong; ethically ambiguous or uncertain
examples: The grey clouds threatened rain all afternoon
His grey beard made him look distinguished
The grey landscape reflected the town's economic decline
Everything seemed grey during those difficult months
This situation falls into a grey area legally
There are many grey zones in medical ethics

definitions: having a slight grey color or tinge mixed with another color
examples: The greyish dawn light filtered through the curtains
His greyish complexion worried the doctor considerably

definitions: feeling or showing intense sorrow, especially because of someone's death
examples: The grieving widow received condolences from many friends
Grieving families gathered at the memorial service yesterday

definitions: very severe or serious, especially in terms of harm or consequences
causing or characterized by severe grief, suffering, or sorrow
examples: The company made a grievous error in judgment
He suffered grievous injuries in the terrible accident
The grievous loss affected the entire community deeply
War brings grievous suffering to innocent civilians

definitions: cooked on a metal grate over heat, creating char marks
examples: The grilled chicken had perfect char marks from cooking
We ordered grilled vegetables as a healthy side dish

definitions: forbidding or uninviting in appearance; harsh and unpleasant looking
deeply serious and depressing; offering little hope or comfort
examples: The grim fortress loomed against the stormy sky
His grim expression warned us not to approach
The doctor delivered the grim diagnosis with careful words
The economic forecast looks increasingly grim this quarter

definitions: holding the attention intensely; extremely interesting or exciting
examples: The gripping thriller kept readers turning pages all night
She told a gripping account of her mountain rescue

definitions: causing horror or disgust through depictions of death or injury
examples: The grisly crime scene shocked even veteran detectives
Newspapers published grisly details of the accident

definitions: containing or covered with small particles of sand or stone
showing courage and resolve in difficult situations; tough and determined
showing unpleasant realities in an uncompromising or stark way
examples: The gritty sand stuck uncomfortably between her toes
This gritty texture ruins the smooth sauce completely
Her gritty determination helped her overcome every obstacle
The team showed gritty performance despite being underdogs
The film's gritty portrayal of urban life won critical acclaim
His novels offer gritty realism about working-class struggles

definitions: having gray or partly gray hair, especially from age or experience
examples: The grizzled veteran shared war stories with younger soldiers
His grizzled beard gave him a distinguished appearance

definitions: having gray or graying hair; similar to grizzled
causing fear or horror; grisly and frightening
examples: The grizzly old sailor had weathered many storms
His grizzly appearance frightened the young children
The grizzly scene horrified everyone who witnessed it
Police described the grizzly details of the crime

definitions: having a neat and clean appearance through careful attention
prepared or trained for a particular purpose or activity
examples: The perfectly groomed executive impressed the board members
Her groomed appearance reflected attention to every detail
He was carefully groomed for leadership from an early age
The groomed successor took over the company smoothly

definitions: marked with long narrow channels or depressions cut into a surface
examples: The grooved surface provided better grip for climbing
Ancient grooved pottery shows sophisticated crafting techniques

definitions: fashionably attractive or exciting; excellent in a trendy way
examples: That groovy music from the seventies still sounds great
She wore groovy vintage clothes to the retro party

definitions: feeling about uncertainly or searching blindly with the hands
examples: His groping attempts to find the light switch failed
The groping search for answers continued through the night

definitions: comically or repulsively ugly or distorted in shape or appearance
incongruous or inappropriate to a shocking or embarrassing degree
examples: The grotesque gargoyles adorned the cathedral's exterior walls
His face became grotesque when he made silly expressions
The grotesque inequality between rich and poor shocked visitors
It was grotesque how much food was wasted daily

definitions: irritable and bad-tempered; inclined to grumble or complain
examples: The grouchy old man complained about neighborhood children
Don't be so grouchy just because you're tired

definitions: introducing new ideas or methods; innovative and pioneering in approach
examples: Her groundbreaking research revolutionized cancer treatment methods
The groundbreaking ceremony marked the project's official start

definitions: not based on any good reason or evidence; lacking justification
examples: Their groundless accusations damaged his reputation unfairly
Your fears about the surgery are completely groundless

definitions: arranged or classified together in one or more groups
examples: The grouped data made analysis much easier to perform
Students were grouped according to their reading ability

definitions: becoming larger or greater over a period of time
not yet mature; still in the process of development
examples: The growing concern about climate change drives policy changes
Her growing influence in politics surprised many observers
Growing children need proper nutrition and adequate sleep
The growing business required more office space

definitions: having reached full size or maturity; fully developed
produced or cultivated in a particular place or way
examples: The grown children moved out of their parents' house
He's a grown man who can make his own decisions
These locally grown vegetables taste fresher than imported ones
Home grown tomatoes have the best flavor possible

definitions: extremely tiring and demanding great effort and endurance
examples: The grueling marathon tested every runner's physical limits
She endured a grueling work schedule for months

definitions: extremely tiring and demanding great effort and endurance
examples: The gruelling training regime prepared soldiers for combat
It was a gruelling climb to the mountain summit

definitions: causing repulsion or horror; grisly and revolting to the senses
examples: The gruesome accident scene required immediate cleanup
Horror movies often feature gruesome special effects

definitions: rough and low in pitch when speaking; abrupt in manner
examples: His gruff voice scared children though he was actually kind
The gruff reply discouraged further conversation attempts

definitions: bad-tempered and sulky; irritable and complaining
examples: The grumpy cat hissed at everyone who approached
Don't talk to him before coffee; he's always grumpy

definitions: cautious and having possible reservations; careful not to reveal emotions
examples: She gave a guarded response to the personal question
His guarded optimism reflected uncertainty about the outcome

definitions: relating to a state governor or the office of state governor
examples: The gubernatorial election attracted national media attention
Several gubernatorial candidates debated tax reform policies

definitions: led, directed, or influenced by someone with expertise or authority
examples: The guided tour included all major historical sites
Guided meditation helps beginners learn proper techniques

definitions: directing or having an influence on the course of action
examples: Her guiding principle was always to help others first
The guiding light of the movement inspired thousands

definitions: responsible for a specified wrongdoing or crime in law
conscious of or affected by a feeling of guilt or remorse
examples: The jury found him guilty of theft and fraud
She was guilty of breaking company policy repeatedly
He felt guilty about missing his daughter's recital
Her guilty conscience kept her awake all night

definitions: easily persuaded to believe something; credulous and naive
examples: The gullible tourists bought overpriced souvenirs from street vendors
Don't be so gullible about internet investment schemes

definitions: having a sticky or viscous consistency like gum or glue
examples: The gummy candy stuck to children's teeth persistently
His eyes were gummy from the infection

definitions: flowing out rapidly and in large quantities with force
expressing excessive enthusiasm or emotion in an unrestrained way
examples: The gushing water from the broken pipe flooded the basement
Blood was gushing from the deep wound
Her gushing praise embarrassed the modest artist considerably
The critic's gushing review seemed over the top

definitions: characterized by sudden strong winds blowing in short bursts
examples: The gusty conditions made sailing particularly challenging today
Gusty winds knocked down several trees overnight
